metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17336 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
UDisks 2.8.0 has a format string vulnerability in udisks_log in udiskslogging.c, allowing attackers to obtain sensitive information (stack contents), cause a denial of service (memory corruption), or possibly have unspecified other impact via a malformed filesystem label, as demonstrated by %d or %n substrings.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17336` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-udisks-2.0 - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
libudisks2-0 - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
udisks2 - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
udisks2-btrfs - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
udisks2-lvm2 - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced by ad2ce6714e911be58011dd6b838ec0f6fd0f950f in udisks 2.6.4

criterions.comment: udisks2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2').
